answers.answer: Well, I would see an opthamologist just in case. But it could also be a blood suger or blood pressure problem. If you get migraines do you usually get an aura? I get the aura then the migraine within about 30 minutes. First thing though is see the eye doctor. I would also post on the eye care or opthamology site too. It is on the forums and they have doctors that get back to you there. Perhaps they have an idea.take care,mkh9
You might want to go get your blood sugar checked

you might  have developed astigmatism... (Sry if i spelled it wrong) My eyes seem to do that when im tired. Check with an optometrist to have it checked out. They can check to see if there is an underlying cause, such as dehydration, diabetes, and glaucoma.

question: I am 34 years old and lately my vision has been getting really blurry all of a sudden.  It’s hard to explain and I can’t seem to pin point what is triggering this. Seems like out of nowhere I will start squinting real bad and can hardly see.. Then it goes back to normal and seems to just come and go. I normally have 20/20 vision. I started thinking maybe that was a sign I was going to get a migraine, but the last two days when this has happens no migraine has come. I am starting to get very worried.. Any Ideas??
title: Help.... Why is my vision randomly blurry
